name: Antica Torre di Via Tornabuoni

reviews.text: We stayed here as a family group and all were delighted by the helpful, friendly staff and the attention to detail in order to give guests a good experience. Central location, good breakfast buffet and breathtaking views from the rooftop terrace make this a hotel I am very pleased to recommend.
reviews.title: superb "boutique" hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in October 2013 following 4 days in Siena. We had a Grand Deluxe Double with a river view. Perfect hotel for seeing Florence, everything to see and do is a matter of minutes away on foot.
reviews.title: A 'must do' hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was modern and tastefully decorated, view fantastic, bathroom ideal for us with a walk in shower. A really splendid breakfast was on offer and the waiting staff very friendly. The rooftop terrace (where there is an honesty box bar for some parts of the day) and a snack/lunch service has the most stunning views over Florence. Front desk/concierge service really helpful.
reviews.title: wedding anniversary
One of the best hotels I've stayed in
reviews.text: The hotel is quite quirky in its layout but it's worth it to maintain the charm and beauty of the building it is located in. It is also literally a stone's throw from the Ponte Vecchio. If we are ever back in Florence we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 30 years of marriage and a wonderful unbeatable location with an unsurpassable roof top vista. The staff were courteous and attentive but never intrusive.The honesty bar is great to sit in the early evening and watch the sun over the Arno. The room was simple and the lift was probably the slowest in the world but ....lovely. Breakfast was truly outstanding.
reviews.title: The roof top terraces are spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Antica Torre for 8 nights in mid-November and loved our time there. The location and the hotel itself are top-notch.
reviews.title: Superior accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit skeptical when we checked in due to the tiny reception area, but once we saw our floor and room (104--Grand Deluxe Romantic), we were sold. Everything about this hotel (except maybe the reception area) is beautiful. Our room was huge--with a separate (large) dressing area which also contained on one end a jetted tub. We had a sofa in the room, a desk, a small table with 4 chairs, and the room was still spacious. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but was nicely appointed and scrupulously clean. It did have ample storage space beneath the vanity. There were also 3 large windows in the room, which overlooked the Arno. How wonderful it was each morning to open the shutters and casement windows to the beautiful view!
reviews.title: Incredibly View of the Duomo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfortable and the bed linens crisp and lovely. We had requested down pillows, which we had, but there were only two. We requested two more, and they were delivered within a very few minutes. The toweling in the bathroom was also high quality--large and thick.
reviews.title: Romatic Hotel In A Romatic City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was something to look forward to each morning. It was quite elaborate; in fact, I never got around to sampling everything even though we were there for so many mornings. The breakfast room overlooked the river and had an adjoining terrace. The servers were friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: LOVED this beautiful hotel and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The terraces are mentioned everywhere in the TA reviews. All I have to add about them is that all the raving about how beautiful they and the views are have not been exaggerated! It's all true. The bar adjoins one of the terraces. It was fun to sit in the bar for a late-night glass of wine and look through the wall of windows at the lovely view.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed hear during our honeymoon. It was my first time to Italy and we visited several cities. We stayed here for our time in Florence. The hotel was absolutely fabulous in every way. Our room had a great view and the breakfast at the top floor was a nice start to each day. The staff was very accommodating and the rooms were fantastic. The real star of this hotel is the location. We walked everywhere we wanted to go in Florence.
reviews.title: Honeymoon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Got the feeling that they will do almost anything to make your stay a pleasant one. Our room had a wonderful view. Great breakfast on the roof top. "Honor" bar on roof top. Next visit to Florence will definitely stay here. Highly recommend
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This must be one of the most romantic palaces in the world. But when booking be sure to request a room with a view...! Everything is perfect, service, location, wonderful breakfasts on the rooftop terrace. Although our stay coincided with the world cycling championships, which disrupted the city somewhat, the Management went overboard to overcome all sorts of problems, such as taxis, garage, etc. Really commendable
reviews.title: Heavenly panorama of Florence

reviews.text: I LOVE this establishment. Located in the posh area of Florence on a corner overlooking the Arno, Antica Torre's rooms are placed in two towers, one of which is medieval. You wouldn't know the age from the inside which is very nicely decorated in a subtle, modern style that manages to keep an air of old grace.
reviews.title: Best service and best views in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers extraordinarily helpful desk staff, a really wonderful full breakfast each morning, bar service, and gratis coffees, teas, and other beverages at all hours.
reviews.title: Fabulous rooftop bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location...right in the center of everything, view of the river from the Panoramic Suite was breathtaking, even scaffolding didn't spoiled it (we were informed in advance). View from both terraces is spectacular, opera music was playing at night....
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious, and hotel staff very accommodating, I have gluten allergy and wanted to eat pizza, so, they made it happened!!!!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you all for making it special.
reviews.title: Michaelangelo would be breathless !

reviews.text: This hotel is on a quiet street yet easily accessible to local tourist sites. The hotel is beautiful, clean, the rooms are a good size and the bed was very comfortable. You have an amazing view of the city and can enjoy it while sipping a glass of wine or coffee on their beautiful rooftop lounge. The breakfast is delicious and the selection is wonderful. The people at the desk were very helpful with directions and recommendations.
reviews.title: Great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: A true Gem.

aka: Antica Torre Di Via Tornabuoni Hotel Florence
description: Antica Torre di Via de' Tornabuoni 1 in Florence is a stunning Historical Residence, centrally located in the birthplace of the Italian Renaissance. The Residence is a Medieval Tower dating from the thirteenth century in elegant Via Tornabuoni, synonymous with the most prestigious brands of Florence. Most of the rooms have a wonderful and exclusive view of the city, the Arno River or of Via Tornabuoni with Santa Trinità square and bridge.All the rooms come fully equipped with all the creature comforts expected of a luxury establishment, including plasma television with Sat-TV, DVD player and free DVD library for our guests, complimentary wireless connection, telephone with direct phone lines, mini-bar, elettronic safe, air conditioning, heating, private bathroom with bath or shower and hair-dryer, slippers.On the rooftop terrace, a Mediterranean and American breakfast is served every morning on a rich buffet served with Richard Ginori porcelains, accompanied by hot beverages and fresh fruit juices. This is all framed by a unique and breathtaking panoramic view of Florence and the surrounding hills, that will contribute to start your day in the most pleasant way.
